Description:
Title: Associate Procurement Buyer

Location: Statewide Multi Use, WA

About Lamb Weston

We love making fries almost as much as you like eating them! Since the 1950’s, Lamb Weston has inspired customers with food they love, trust, and share with families and friends. As a leading global manufacturer of quality frozen potato products with over 9,000+ team members around the world, it’s our business to see the possibilities in potatoes and people.

We are looking for team members with an appetite for a challenge! People who are hungry to join a winning team and help us make a difference in the world. When you join Lamb Weston, you join a community with a strong support network and training programs designed to nurture, inspire, and help you grow.

We are driven by a relentless pursuit of results and by people who think creatively and embrace our values of: Integrity, Teamwork, Inclusion, Drive for Results, and Empowerment. Exactly what you’d expect from the most inventive potato company in the world!

Join Lamb Weston! We bring the world together with our fries.

Job Description Summary

The Associate Procurement Buyer is responsible for the purchasing of goods and services from approved suppliers, in a manner consistent with approved quality standards and delivery requirements. The Procurement Buyer will be required to support and assist development of the purchasing function to advance department or organizational goals, objectives, and interests. Finally, the Procurement Buyer is also responsible for the day-to-day resolution of stakeholder and supplier issues. The position will work with Plant and Administrative Personnel, Corporate Procurement, Accounts Payable, and external suppliers.

Job Description

Incorporate sourcing, contracting, and supplier management principles into daily work activitiesGather necessary information to complete sourcing events (spot buys), support negotiations, support contracting, support supplier implementation, and support supplier management activities as requiredPurchase assigned items, supplies and materials or services in accordance with approved buying programs using the established procurement policyAssist with projects at manager's directionDocument and resolve supplier quality and performance problems using KPI’s, by identifying root causes and implementing corrective actions to prevent re-occurrenceDemonstrate a strong understanding of the P2P process, compliance, and data managementImplementation of cost improvement projectsAssist procurement resources with category or supplier issuesLead with identification, development, and implementation of initiatives providing working capital reductionsForecasting, invoice reconciliation, and good receipts in support of business continuitySolve supply and service problems, ensuring high levels of pricing / contract compliance and seamless customer service to all Lamb Weston stakeholders

Basic & Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred; or equivalent related experience or training3+ years of experience in procurement, purchasing, or related field. 3+ years of working in a supply chain or manufacturing firm preferredAbility to leverage computer software programs, specifically SAP or a comparable ERP solution, in addition to office productivity toolsAbility to manage multiple priorities or projectsAbility to influence management and build teamsAbility to work independently and as a team player, be organized, and plan aheadAbility to maintain, develop, and execute departmental visionExcellent problem solving, interpersonal, and organizational skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to learn quickly while also leading and teaching othersAbility to travel locally within the greater Tri-Cities, WA area up to 10%

Industry-Competitive Benefits

Coupled with our compensation and bonus incentive programs, our benefits deliver rewards that are market competitive. Some of the most attractive elements of our benefit programs include:

Health Insurance Benefits - Medical, Dental, VisionFlexible Spending Accounts for Health and Dependent Care, and Health Reimbursement AccountsWell-being programs including companywide events and a wellness incentive programPaid Time OffFinancial Wellness – Industry leading 401(k) plan with generous company contributions, Financial Planning Services, Employee Stock purchase program, and Health Savings Accounts, Life and Accident insuranceFamily-Friendly Employee eventsEmployee Assistance Program services – mental health and other concierge type services

Benefits may vary based on location, job role/level, job status, and/or the terms of any applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Job Requisition ID: Req-234310

Time Type: Full time

Anticipated Close Date: 06/16/2024

In compliance with applicable state and local laws, Lamb Weston has opted to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation for this role. This compensation is specific to this position and takes into account a number of variables. Actual compensation may be higher or lower in the range posted based on various factors, including, but not limited to, job duties, experience and expertise. A candidate’s work location could also impact the actual compensation being outside of the range to reflect local cost of labor. A reasonable annual estimate of the range for this role based on the variables previously mentioned is: $49,200.00 - $73,810.00

Lamb Weston is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
